I really love this park with it's trails and well behaved dogs and well trained owners.
author: Steve S.

description: Great place to let the dogs run while taking in some pretty nifty views on a clear day. Worth the exit off the highway to get a brief stretch for both man and dog(s).
author: Nick W.

description: Amazing views!!! Definitely try to go during sunrise or sunset. Take some amazing pictures. Post to instagram and facebook. Immediate bragging rights! :-)
author: Amanda C.

description:
Probably one of my absolute favourite places in the city to go chill out. It's a nice walk up from the mission but so worth it for the views.

Night-time gives it a whole new dimension of special and is great to day dream out at the night sky and forget about the noise for awhile. Wrap it warm though in case the fog comes in.
author: Annie L.

description:
Looking at San Francisco is one of my favorite things to do, and Bernal Heights gives you a unique view from the South. The entire Mission district sprawls in front of you, and you can see the bay off to your right and the Financial District off in the distance. 

Plus, you can get ice cream at MaggieMudd's as a reward for hiking up that big hill :)
author: Maia B.

description:
Love this place and has one of the best views. I prefer it over twin peaks. 
 Beautiful place for Photos, day or night. 
You can take in the views and then walk down to Cortland ave for lunch or dinner in one of the greatest neighborhoods in the Bay Area.
author: P.N. G.

description: If I was a tourist in San Francisco, THIS is where I'd come for a great view. It beats Twin Peaks in my book!
author: Michael S.

description:
Nice park to walk your dog with a spectacular view of the city.
Friendly dog owners, joggers and urban hikers share this park.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I love it here! The view is amazing and my dog gets plenty of play time, lots of other friendly dogs (and owners). And lots of off leash dogs.

Will be coming here a lot more. It's also a good exercise, because you have to walk up to the hill.
author: Gabriele A.

description:
I adore this park and it's character -- in no small part due to the people who come here. But I have a little complaint:

Could somebody remake the rock labyrinth? It is the same design as 1- 2- 3- no .... 4 years ago!? I swear, I ran it this weekend, it feels exactly the same as the first time!

And one question: does anybody know where I may find a nice restroom outside of library hours?
author: Pinata L.

description:
I had to dog-sit Billy one weekend in SF. Billy is a country dog - he lives in Saratoga and has a nice sized yard to run in. My parents take him to the park at least twice a day and he thinks he rules the neighborhood. 

Clearly, he wasn't all that fond of my apartment life in SF. Luckily, I was prepared and I brought him to Bernal Heights. Bill and I ran up and down the hill for about an hour. He enjoyed sniffing everything off-leash and I enjoyed a fantastic view of the city. We would have stayed longer but it started to rain so Billy & I ran back into my car. 

For the rest of the afternoon, he sat on my couch and didn't bother me much. I guess the exercise worked for both of us. If I had a dog in the city, I'd go to Bernal Heights at least once a week for both the sanity of my dog and me.
author: Yi Z.

description: This is another of my favorite urban parks - amazing views and loads of cute doggies to meet.  When I lived in San Francisco I used to ride my bike here and hike around the hill and then go home - great little short workout - outdoors with views.  Can't beat it!
author: Jenn C.

description: Randomly stumbled across this park after a lunch in the mission and what a find! The "hike" up the trail is easy (I did it in some chunky sandals bc I did NOT know we were gonna be walking post-lunch) and the view is AMAZING! Seriously. Bring yo' iphones, snap some instas and rack up them likes.
author: Audrey Y.

description:
For a perfect weekend afternoon:

1) Take one, beautiful, glorious sunshiny January day with little wind.
2) Add a stop at Avedano's for picnic provisions: Pressed Cuban Sandwich, Porchetta with sauteed mushrooms and pickled cabbage; some broccolini with lemon, pine nuts and yellow raisins, swiss chard sauteed with bacon. Italian mineral water
3) Add a frisky, crazy puppy who's raring to go.
4) Embark on your climb up some gentle gravely slopes.
5) Pick your perch.
6) Enjoy.
author: Claudine C.

description:
Hey I've lived at the base of this hill for 12 years and I still marvel at how many people return from ascending this "scenic must", happier and very excited about San Francisco.  Tourist have remarked how it reminds them of Italy.
Just think, from this hill on the right day in early spring you can actually see the sunset and moonrise in opposing skies at the same time. When you're ready to move on, walk down to Cortland for a unique neighborhood
experience day or night.

ENJOY!
author: Kingmond Y.

description: Every time I come out to Bernal Heights, the more I want to move here. oh my goodness! I swear, if I'm ever going to move to SF, I am saving up lots of money to buy a place in Bernal Heights!!! Not only are the views phenomenal, but the hills!!! THE HILLS ARE AMAZING. I'm a uphill sprinter (if that's a real thing), and NOTHING beats the hills of Bernal Heights...... And on top of the Bernal Heights Park, you basically can see the 360 of SF, so that's pretty amazing..... I highly, highly recommend you go there...... not too often though, cause I don't want it to be super crowded when I go... :)
author: Christine C.

description:
When were were kids growing up in the flats of the Mission, looking up to Bernal Hill was like being a world away.  We used to call it Fog City Mountain, because, well we didn't know it had any other name and our name fit.

Every summer, before we started heading over to the Boys Club (now the Girls and Boys Club) we would go on these "Great Expeditions". Sometimes we would ride our bikes through the hallways of the spooky San Francisco General Hospital, sometimes we would have picnics at Raza Park (Potrero del Sol), other times we would swing on the swings for hours at 24th Mini, but when we wanted to get away from it all and really go on a TRIP - we packed our bags and headed for the HILL!

With PB&J and our juice boxes in tow we headed across the treacherous Army Street(now Cesar Chavez) overpass and then proceeded to climb the over 100 steps up to Bernal Heights.  From there we ended up taking different routes to get to the base of Bernal Hill.  We would actually hike up the side (we had no clue there was an access road back then).

Once we reached the top we would sit on the grass and look over our neighborhood and point out our school, our church, our parks, the hospital and we would talk about how many times we would go downtown (we could count them on two hands) on "Special Occasions".  It was a truly magical time, when the city felt bigger than it actually was.  Actually it was a bigger city then.

Today, I took Lola for the first time and shared with her some of those memories.
author: A P.

description:
My boyfriend, the Captain, took me to the hill the first time I came out to visit him in San Francisco.  It was such a breathtaking experience that I fell in love with him and the city and decided to move across the country so I wouldn't have to be seperated from either ever again!

We sat inside the roots of a tree drinking wine, watching the day fade into night and  the city come alive.  The view of the city from Bernal Hill is magnificent.  Just as we were about to leave the most spectacular fireworks display I have ever seen lit up the sky right in front of us.   It was the end to one of those days that's so perfect you couldn't possibly have planned it.  It had to be a gift from the universe. 

It can be pretty windy so bring someone you want to hold and keep warm!  Also, I've heard there are some ducklings up there.
author: P J.

description:
Off leash area for dogs, great view for humans. 
There is a doggy drinking fountain, areas for dogs to run around, however there isn't much grass.
author: Skye W.

description: This place is dope! Can't believe I've been here for 5 years and have yet to check this place out.  It offers a 360 view of the city. I saw a couple having a picnic on the slope overlooking the city.  The boy was pulling out all the stops.  I was like, "Damn, he got game." Take a girl here!
author: Alex G.

description: One of my favorite spots in the city, hands down. View is even more amazing at nighttime. If you want to blow someone's mind, definitely bring them here.
author: Nemesis J.

description: What a wonderful place to grow up! So many memories, Joe's Creamery; the Cherokee all seem to have disappeared. But many of us are still in touch. Help keep the memories alive of this incredible place. Join https://www.facebook.com/groups/bernalheights/ and accompany us as we revisit Bernal Heights. Post pictures, memories and find old friends.
author: Pat R.

description: Came last night for the first time and we didn't get out of the car. The view was nice from where we parked, but I'm sure it's even nicer when you get higher up and/or during the day. Will update the review then :)
author: Puja K.

description: Came here right around sunset and the view from here was just gorgeous!  Then as it started getting dark, all the lights from the city and the lights from across the bay were glistening and beautiful as well.  We got here by walking up Folsom from Cesar Chavez and it wasn't that bad of a walk at all.  I personally liked this place and the 360° view from here, versus Twin Peaks.  Thankfully we got here on a clear and not too cold day so that was nice.  A lot of off-leash dogs come here to play.  Would love to come back here again one day!
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
5 Stars for providing me and Sharon S (and our respective mates) with a fun day of "let's go find that one slide up in Bernal and go sliding"

What a fun adventure!
author: Nikki M.

description: Fresh air and GREAT views of The City!!!! Can't get any better than this. Very peaceful too.
author: C D.

description: A really cute quick hike in the city which has a perfect 360-degree view. I recently went on this hike with my family after looking up the yelp reviews and I was so pleased. It wasn't too long and it wasn't too short, just the perfect length for a nice relaxing hike. We parked our car right on Bernal Heights Blvd after we turned from Bradford St. It was pretty good parking - the only thing was that the entrance to get onto the short hill was a little muddy and slippery because it just rained. We later learned that there was a gravel parking lot a little farther down the road, but that also leads you down the hill a little and I really enjoyed walking up the hill, instead of on a road path. I guess it's upto you, whatever you prefer, but there are multiple options for how you want to hike it up. Once you get to the top, you can walk around the cell tower fencing and see views of all sides of the city! It's a spectacular view and just great on a clear day - I highly recommend it to anyone :)
author: Malika R.

description:
I am all for neighborhoods that pay homage to what little land that developers and Nature can afford us.  This little hill gives me a moment to step away from all that smog and traffic of the city and take a walk with people and wildlife.  Sometimes, rabbits will run across our pathway, another time is watching children play in front of us.

The hike gave me a reason to get my butt back into the gym, but for several events that were held here, it gave me the opportunity to get a wicked sunburn while facing the sun people watching.
author: Miika M.

description: This place has awesome views and a lot of open space for a nice long walk.  Not much shade so bring water and wear a hat.  Is this an official off leash play area?  Wouldn't want a hefty fine.
author: Mark I.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite spots within the city.  Puts views from Coit Tower to shame.  A pleasant/easy walk from the Mission, and then a number of ways to get to the park.  I like to walk straight up Folsom from Caesar Chavez to get the ultimate butt blast workout.  You shoot straight up Folsom to the very top, and you'll see the park.  Continuing walking up - definitely not a hike but also not a leisurely walk.  Some loose gravel, dirt....eh, it's not so bad.  Just make sure to wear sneakers (although I will admit I did this once in flipflops and I survived).  There's a cellphone tower up top that's fenced off, but you can see the view from outside the perimeter of the tower.  There's really no need to go to the very top where the tower is.  On the weekends and on nice days, you are guaranteed to find families/couples/friends enjoying the grassy mountain side and lots of DOGS!  My dog loves this park simply because he can go off-leash, play fetch, and make some new doggie friends.  

The best part is the way down - you can stop at the Bernal Heights Mini Slide Park and then go to Mitchell's after.  

Nighttime provides gorgeous views of the city (think Twin Peaks minus all of the cars/tourists).  Just make sure to dress warmly because the wind at the top can get pretty bad.
author: Naomi P.

description:
on a good day, take a moment to scale this thing. 

dont take the nice, ambling path that leads to the dog park. you'll be outflanked by extremely happy people and their bubbly, excited dogs that also think they're human. its not bad really, except you might be breathing a bit rapidly, while an off-leash, nearly bipedal shiba inu is matching your stride and trying to master human language with you. while you ponder your mortality, u hear scooby doo making almost articulate conversation like, "u look tired. i recommend my artisan diet of mackerel, goat and long-stem jasmine rice! it'll perk u right up!"

instead, clutch your heart n pound up the hill using the crass, dirt paths made by proud primates before you. grab at tuffs of soil n rocks n climb like an extra in that long forgotten smashing pumpkins music video. reaching the top, your souveniers will include scuffed up vans sneakers, some sweat, dirt, knowledge that you are alive, a good view, and dominion over ALL DOGKIND.

wtf. its a hill with a nice view. just go.
author: mee n.

description: A great place for dogs.  They can roam freely off-leash.
author: Brandon L.

description: Great hill with a great view of the city.  I slipped and fell though (pretty hard on my ass and hands) on part of the trail so if you see drips of blood around some rocks towards the top, don't worry, it's just mine. LOL
author: Adrian N.

description:
As a native San Franciscan... I'm sorry it took me so long to finally visit this place!

Great views of the city, and spent a bunch of time trying to figure out the neighborhoods by landmarks.

Love the labyrinths (for prayerful/meditative walking).

At the top we were lucky enough to see the nest of a red tailed hawk with it's little ones practicing flying. :)
author: Angel L.

description:
** HaikuReview ** 

Dogs can run amuck
Outstanding views of the Bay 
Watch out for that wind!
author: Shereen R.

description: Another SF treasure. Gentle walking trails lead to the summit which has an unsightly radio tower. But, there are many fabulous vista's that should not be missed. If you are made of sturdier stuff and want short and more inclined paths, they are in abundance also. If you live the City and are a runner, this is your spot.
author: Richard D.

description:
Up that road
Up that hill
Up into the Heights of Bernal
Where you gaze
Amongst the Gods and clouds
Onto the view that is forever eternal.
The chimney stacks stack white bliss
To add into the mist
And the ship and cars
Oh how they travel so far!
The men and women i see
Below with French Pugs
Going to their afternoon pubs
These are the Heights
Where such a sight
Of a living force all around
Exists down on the ground.
On this mountain we can all sing
And through The Mission
You shall hear my words ring!
author: Jon-o G.

description:
This place is absolutely breathtaking.

So nice that my dog even wrote a blog about it ;) www.bearnamedbrady.wordpress.com

Anyway, came here today to do a 45 minute hike w/ the boyfriend & pup and it was pretty damn amazing. Tons of space to walk and its REALLY clean!!!! No litter! :) I love it! Tons of friendly dogs around. It's basically an off-leash park, but if your dog likes to wander ... then I suggest you to keep them on leash.. since they could possibly go under a railing and hop over to another near by hill!

The best thing about this hill is when you go all the way on top! Totally breathtaking. Can't wait to go back and set up a picnic there. Not to mention, the air is so fresh and smells nicer than usual at the top!
author: Meg W.

description:
One of the best places in the city to go at night.

Your dog will be more popular than you.
author: Bob S.

description: good views of San Francisco and the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Brian B.

description:
I noticed this place after a friend of mine moved in around here a couple weeks ago.  I was driving on up to his place and noticed the breathtaking views on the side, and the park sign to my right.  So, what else could I think of but taking my boo up here??

My boo and I rode the motorcycle to SF (free tolls on weekdays, why not?) and got up here.  There's parking right in front of it, but not much (just park at the residence areas).  The place had a good amount of people with their dogs, though.  It was interesting-there's a hiking/walking trail, there's also some steps and hike to move on up quicker, benches are spread out for those resting moments, and there's a map to see where to go.  But really, just walk around-see the graffiti painted on the top walls, jump up onto the various hills you see beside you, and take pictures of the multi-colored houses that are implanted with the Bay and Golden Gate Bridges.

I'd love to come here on a sunny day to read/write a book.  That would be quite pleasant.  Walking with your dogs is enjoyable, and using this location as a workout place is useful.  But coming here with your boo-what a dream come true! *hehe*
author: Lili K.

description:
Probably one of my top 3 places in the city.

I found this place randomly, sorta. I was at the blue tower thing in John McLaren Park, and as I was looking out at the beautiful view I wondered what that hill across my way was. So I hopped into my car, and tried to find it. Within 10 mins I found myself at Bernal Heights Hill. Score!

This place is perfect for me.. to enjoy sweet solitude. 

Ah, I love finding places without planning ahead. It makes me feel proud of myself.
author: Emily V.

description: This is one of my favorite places in San Francisco, a place that feels truly spacious in a city that is one of the densest in the country.  There is something amazing about seeing the whole city from this above so quickly and completely.  It puts things into perspective, and makes a great spot for contemplation.  The rich history of the location clearly has an impact, as do the hundreds of joyful and insane dogs (not to mention people) that run around the top daily.  A real treasure for urban dwellers.
author: Dan S.

description:
Bernal Heights Hill is hand down, one of the best places to take in a view of the city! I love that it's so close to home, it could almost be my yard. I love getting home from work and taking a hike up the hill to get some good ol exercise and watch all the cute little doggies getting their exercise too. I wish my dog Yoda was still around so I could walk him on the hill. It's also a great place to watch fireworks, if it's not foggy...hahaha! 

Also, if you come down the Southwest side of the hill and over one street, there's a slide that takes you part of the way down.
author: Marcie L.

description:
Gorgeous location. If you haven't had the chance to take a walk here you MUST make the time...borrow a pup from someone if you must ;)
Stunning views and great people make for not only great exercise but great conversation!
author: Caitlin R.

description: An absolutely breathtaking oasis trampled on by many dogs but not too many tourists makes Bernal Heights Hill the perfect destination for the local who wants to like feel king or queen of this beautiful city we call San Francisco...
author: Sue L.

description: I illustrated my experience at SFBay . ca: http://sfbay.ca/2012/06/12/bernal-heights-park/
author: Mari N.

description: I just walked up here for the first time and loved it.  After the crazy storm last night, the city brightened up and I decided to get out and it was wonderful to find this little gem!  The walk up to the hill is actually more strenuous than walking from the base of the park to the peak.  It was wonderful that it was paved, so it wasn't at all muddy.  Actually, even the off paved path wasn't TERRIBLY muddy as one would expect after the storm.  The views were great and overall it was such a wonderful afternoon!  Definitely recommend checking it out on a nice day.
author: Rachana S.

description:
The top affords an interesting perspective on the Mission and the Financial District, and one of the only hill-views of Glen Park, Hunter's Point, and John McLaren park. It has a nice wilderness feel, unkempt, with little or no landscaping. Plenty of dogs taking craps. 

But it lacks something. Very wide expanses of simple grass turn me off, I suppose. Or perhaps it's the fenced-in radio tower at the top, which just doesn't have the alien doomsday charm of Sutro tower. I do enjoy it's looming presence over the mission, especially coming down Fulton.
author: Geronimo G.

description: Beautiful views day or night, nature in the city. Dogs off leash. Cute first date night, take out Chinese food & the bench on the top of the hill. Best of all? It's free.
author: Shannon Z.

description: Nice view for sure, just watch out for the foxtails for your pups.
author: E T.

description:
I lived in SF for 6 years now and never set my foot here maybe because no one had ever told me about this place.

I've been to Twin Peeks, Treasure Island, Sausalito, Fort Scott, Crissy Fields, Golden Gate Bridge, Top of the Mark, De Young Museum, Cliff House, Equinox, Legion of Honor, Coit Tower, Alcatraz, and on top of my roof to watch the city from above. But never knew this. 

It's breathtaking and somewhat smelly from all the dog poop. But hey, it's a nice view of the city, somewhat 360 almost. If you point out every part of the bay area, I salute you.
author: Stanley K.

description:
I never knew about this place until Friday. After our dinner at Chez Spencer, my bf still had a surprise for me. When we were almost there, he had me close my eyes and wait for him in his car until he came and got me. 

When he was done and got me, we started walking up the hill. I saw this light and I was like what is that? Got closer and I noticed that it was candles! Got closer and there was a little bench with candles on both sides and one right in front of the bench. There was a blanket on the bench and we sat there with the blanket and the chocolate and looked at the BEAUTIFUL VIEW of the city. 

Then there was a group of teenagers that was walking down the hill and saw what he had down and starting saying, "Oh, this guy got game" or "He's so sweet" I loved everything he did and think all guys should be doing things like that all the time!

Everything was going so well and it was so romantic until the cops started flashing their flashlights at those teens then us. They were questioning them and since they were here and kicking them out, we knew we were gonna get kicked out also. So we just got everything and started walking to them just to let them know we were leaving. The cop was nice and apologized for ruining our moment. I guess not ALL cops are douche-bags!

All in all, romantic view and a romantic spot!
author: Juliane N.

description: Great view of the Sutro tower, downtown skyline, bay bridge, and a little of the East Bay across the water. The view on the west, so good for sunsets when the sky gradients into lots of colors. :) Many bring their dogs to walk on the trail. And in the front there's a labyrinth made of rocks!
author: Angela L.

description:
Dear Bernal Heights Hill, 

We are currently dog sitting our good friend's miniature Australian shepherd, Rufus. He is a bit of a nervous dog, and lately has been a tad constipated. We've added olive oil to his food and made sure that he drinks lots of water. And we let him out into our backyard to do his business, but he just can't seem to drop the kids off at the pool, if you know what I mean. So, we brought him up to the hill. Within minutes, Rufus took his first dump in days. I don't know what it is. Maybe the great view of the city relaxed him. Or maybe being around other dogs reminded him that he too could take a dump in the grass. Whatever the reason,  thank you Bernal Heights Hill for being the laxative that Rufus needed. 

Warmly, 
Caroline C. and Bill
author: Caroline C.

description: My new favorite dog park in the city!  Ok, it's not walking distance from my house but Bernal Heights Hill offers some of the best views in the city while allowing dogs to roam about off leash.  It was the perfect venue for the first DYB event--5 big stars!
author: phil h.

description:
Bernal Hill is easily one of the best views of San Francisco.  And it is perched atop one of the best neighborhoods to make it even more of a brilliant force.  Officially this is a dog park and I believe it is one of if not the only park in SF where dogs are allowed off leash.

There are many angles to come at the hill from to get to the top.  One of the routes leading up from Mission Street takes you up several public staircases that are built into the steep neighborhood streets.  You'll pass by gardens and slides.  

Another way of reaching the top is to follow Folsom Street up to the base of the hill and then spiral around the mountain until you can't go anymore. 

And there are a number of paths to the hill cutting over from Cortland Avenue. Some of these routes involve a tiny amount of climbing and evading barking guard dogs.  But all of these roads will bring you to a magnificent view of SF that is usually sitting above the fog even when other parts of the city find themselves covered.

Two dear friends of mine were just married on Bernal Hill a few weeks ago on a perfectly warm Saturday afternoon. It was one of the most touching and beautiful ceremonies I've witnessed yet.  The spectacular backdrop of the city from Bernal Hill totally added to the love fest.
author: Sharon R.

description:
Yaaaay!
I enjoyed the fireworks here on 4th of July.
Perched atop the windy hill we took in the spectacular display as the entire city was lit up before our eyes. I must admit that the "illegal" neighborhood set-offs rivaled what I saw of the embarcadero. I was even able to see a teeny weeny bit of the action over in the eastbay. This was the perfect ending to wonderful sunny day spent with good friends good food and massive amounts of alcohol.

Bring the following items:
(1)Winter coat
(2)Hat & Scarf
(3)Blanket
(4)Bottle of Wine

After the show proceed to Mitchell's for an ice cream sundae. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
Thanks everyone for giving my neighborhood 5 star reviews. But really though, the weather on this side is so much better than the other side of the city. Gotta love that!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
We pulled up to Bernal Heights Hill with my three suitcases in the car.  My watch was still set to New York time.  It was a perfect San Francisco day, my friend told me; foggy in patches, sunny in the Mission, and a goosebump causing breeze.  We parked, hopped out, patted a cute dog; the gravel crunched under my flip flops and the trees looked light years' different from the ones back East.  We climbed to the top and I hoped like hell my old sandals stayed intact.  I felt like the wind would blow me off the mountain.

The view was priceless.  My friend pointed out the neighborhoods and I watched as the city became a sort of grid.  The fog covered Twin Peaks.  I moved!  I laughed to my friend.  I'm here!  It was sort of like a postcard view of San Francisco with a tiny me jumping up and down and waving in the foreground.
author: Ellie L.

description:
Aside from the antenna and the road, most of this bald hilltop is untouched.  In the middle of all this urban bliss, that's amazing.

Come on up on a clear, windless day.  Better yet, come on a bright, hot day.  Bring your camera because you'll want to kick your own ass if you don't.  Wear good shoes and try some of those teensy weensy trails that switchback up the hillside.  Watch your step!  The hillside is STEEP.
author: Randy F.

description:
I've been to Bernal Heights Hill many o times and I never grow tired of this place. The view of San Francisco on a beautiful, clear day is amazing. You get a panoramic view of the city that is slightly different from the other vista points (i.e., Twin Peaks and Koit Tower). You see views of other districts that may be neglected by tourists, which include the Mission, Potrero Hill, Noe Valley, and the Bayview. 

Aside from the views, you will see fabulous looking dogs and their owners. Most of them are on leash and super friendly. You will also see bike riders huffing and puffing but ultimately making it to the top to enjoy the view as well. It's a great place for day hikes and you get the best of both worlds -- nature with an urban landscape. Definitely make this a part of the rounds when taking people around.
author: Dorothy S.

description:
I took my dog for an evening walk here tonight and I don't go up here to often anymore. I do have some stories from Having Kegs up here back in the young days to a unmetionable situation or two.

I never really appreciated the view as much when I was young and my dad would force me to take walks with him and my stepmom.

Tonight was clear and not very cold I love coming up here other dog owners were pretty friendly as well. Good safe spot for a evening walk.
author: Kim R.

description:
If you're a dog owner who lives in Bernal Heights, I'm sure this review is useless to you, as you already go here every day.

Now for the rest of us: If you love parks, views, and/or hilltops in general, and you live in the city, Bernal Heights Hill had better be on your to-do list.  I mean, we all drive by this hill on the 101, and it has such a unique profile against the sky...how can your curiosity not beckon you up here?  

Great views of the city, and especially great views when the fog is rolling in over twin peaks.  Not to mention some great neighborhoods to walk in nearby, especially if you head down Esmeralda stairway.
author: Wes M.

description:
I had wanted to trek to this hill for awhile now, but didn't know which way to even approach it from.  The grade coming from Folsom isn't bad, but I'm still glad I didn't bother making the hike, opting instead to have a friend drive us up.

It's pretty barren at the top, which makes it less creepy than other parks at night--any activity that goes on up here is easier to spot.  

Although unsightly, the radio tower and its surrounding fence can at least shield you from the wind, depending on where it's blowing from and where you stand.  If you're planning to have any kids in the future, I'd advise against getting too close to the tower.

Five stars for the view and for the calming effect it elicits.  It makes any thought of moving out of the City that much harder.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
My friends recently got wed on this hill. OMG the views are off the hook. 

One star off because as non-native SF'ians we had no idea where the F**K we were, and a lot of folks had trouble getting transportation to and fro.
author: Ingrid G.

description:
My husband is an assface & won't let me have a dog.. ok ok, it's actually my landlord who won't let me have one, but I think that guy I married is in on it.
Anyway, I have to get my dog fix somehow & this hill is a fiiiiiine place to do so. Not only will you be surrounded by cutie canines large & small, but you'll have an amazing view of the city! This is a great place to bring your friends from out of town & point out all the places they wanted to see, but you refused to take them because you're not a tourist.

So basically, I love this place.. especially when we stop at Maggie Mudd's afterwards! ha!
author: Melisser E.

description:
In a city that is getting increasingly anti-dog, Bernal Hill is a one-of-a-kind oasis for dogs and their humans.  It's one of the few off-leash areas left in San Francisco, where dogs can run without having to worry about crashing into a fence or a wall, like in the pitifully small and urine-soaked "dog runs" that some other S.F. parks have.  Basically, for dogs, it's pretty close to being heaven on earth -- a mix of paved roads, dirt trails the higher up on the hill you get, and plenty of green for you and your pooch to hang out on, chill, and watch the rest of the world go by.

On a clear day, you can see Mount Diablo and the Marin Headlands.  There are few things better than being on the hill on a sunny and brisk morning or afternoon, looking at the deep blue of the bay, or watching the fog roll in over Twin Peaks like a blanket, totally above the noise of the city.  This is one of the places that makes living in San Francisco extremely special.
author: moosedog i.

description:
Adorable dogs will always make me smile up here!  And that slide...so fun...I'll get to that in a minute. Almost five stars, but, man... on a hot day the stench of dog pooh and pee can be really overwhelming.  I should know....I just got back and I feel like the smell is trapped in my nostrils.  

Other than that, this is a great place for some thight/butt-burning exercise, doggie walking, and excellent views of the city.  For extra fun, take the stairs (on the west side of the hill...about 1/2 way up) down the hill and just keep walking. You'll find another set of stairs about a block down. Running alongside the stairs is a big old slide that is totally fun!  The slide and the hill itself were two of the reasons I fell in love with this 'hood.
author: Abby W.

description:
Sept. 26th
I decided to go on a bike ride tonight. I left a little after 10pm and road my bike up to Bernal Hill. I had to stop and walk a bit half way up Folsom Street because that freakin' hill doesn't quit! 

I made my way up and up, stopping to look down at the city lights. Once I finally got to the tippy top I was amazed. The city is so beautiful from up here. I sat down next to my bike on the dirt and saw the cargo ships in the bay. They were glowing, their lights reflecting in the water. I thought about when I use to walk the dogs over there by the water. There was this random sitting area all the way down 24th I think. You just go all the way down until you hit the water. You can see a bunch of warehouses that have been decorated with colorful graffiti. I always liked going there even if it is all industrial.

The moon is full, or almost. I think it's full because my friend KaLai told me that the Moon Cake Festival was today. She says they celebrate it in Hong Kong. Anyways, I sat down and ate some of my ginger candies and stared at the Bay Bridge, downtown, and The Mission. I can see my house! I look back and I can even see the towers in Brisbane. I look to my left and see Twin Peaks. My eye follows the Bay Bridge again and Oakland is twinkling in the distance. The light that the city is giving off is so powerful.....I can see in the dark because of it.

I look up at the sky and I see a shooting star over Pacific Heights. I immediately make a wish......but I think real hard......we'll see if it comes true. My eyes are closed and I can hear the hushed rumbling of the city. That noise never quits....you can always count on that. I open my eyes and count the planes in the sky.....1, 2, 3.......4,5...........6. I know they are planes because I see their lights flying across the bay. I can even hear one of the jet engines.

I'm so happy that I came up here! The temp is perfect......and it's fairly clear out. I walk around to the different hills to get new vantage points. I'm thinking that it would have been nice to share tonight with someone, but I didn't, just me and my city. Things sure have changed a lot ever since I moved up here from SC over 2 1/2 years ago. 

I grab my bike and head downward to ride on the access road. I check the message boards for anything interesting. I found a flyer for a "free market" in Dolores Park on Saturday @ 1pm. I guess everyone brings something to give away and then you can take whatever you want. Maybe I'll go check it out, it sounds interesting. www.reallyreallyfree.org 

Ridding downhill in the dark is kinda cool and terrifying all at the same time. This is when I'm thankful that I have brakes on my bike. I'd like to see you fixed gear kids come up here with me and ride downhill. It's a fucking challenge, believe me. Basically I zip down Folsom and take 24th to my flat. 

I just got home and wanted to share this with you guys. Let me know if anyone ever wants to come back up here, especially at night. Or if anyone ever wants to go on an adventure....I'm always down. Sweet dreams you guys...........
author: Natalie H.

description: A lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.  Exercise, fresh air, amazing views, cute dogs, cute humans.  It's a weekend habit for me.
author: Amanda R.

description:
One of the best walk and talk and think experiences in the city.  Go up on your own, with a friend or with an out of town guest.

It's quiet but you don't feel too alone; it's an expansive view, but the viewing spot itself feels intimate; the walks up and down both take effort, but instead of getting tired, I have more energy when I'm done.

It occurs to me that I should put my laptop to sleep and actually go walk Bernal Hill now instead of only writing about it!
author: Cynthia B.

description:
It always amazes me how many people who live in San Francisco don't know about this place. We love Bernal Hill. Not only is it a hop skip and a woof from where we live, but it's one of those gems that make you go "Wow! Can't believe there's a place like this in the city!".

It offers a huge open space for the doggies to run free.. free.. FREE! And you get grand views of basically everything. So pack a picnic and check it out!
author: N K.

description: Great place to take your puppy for a walk. Lovely views of the city on a sunny day.
author: Emma C.

description:
This park provides a spectacular view of the City. Just look out for the dog walkers. We were there for two hours and didn't encounter a dog walker with less than eight dogs - two over the legal limit. Bernal is a dog friendly neighborhood and there are a lot of dog walkers who obviously take advantage of this. 

We went there exclusively so Pippi could run around but I don't like it when we come upon two dog walkers with a pack of 18. No one can control that many pups and it's not fair to them or the rest of us.
author: Karen H.

description:
After living all of my life in San Francisco, I am ashamed to say today was the first day that I've ever been to Bernal Heights Hill.

I came out this Sunday morning for a little conservation work with the parks people. We pulled radish and wild oats and fox tails. It was AMAZING! Well, not getting down into the dirt. That was okay. And something you can participate in ever 3rd Sunday of the month.

It was amazing because we got to see a couple of birds almost do it. In like the boy bird totally tried to mate with the girl bird right in front of us! She wasn't having any of it (at least not in public) and she flew away.

And then there was another bird that swooped down to get a grasshopper that our weeding exposed. Carnal!

And then we got to go on a wild flower tour of the hill. It was so beautiful. The teeny tiny little wildflowers surviving on this windy rock of a hill. 

And then there are the views! Gorgeous views of the Mission and downtown. 

And that's why I love living in this hilly seaside town.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
I absolutely love Bernal Hill. When I am stressed I hop on my bike and pump my little legs til I reach the very top. Then I stand there sweating and panting and marvel at the beauty that is the bay area. I always feel very alive when i am up there. That is why I would like some good pal to sprinkle some of my ashes up there when I die.

Only bummer for me is that I am usually outnumbered by dogs and sometimes it smells like dog pee/poop up there. Also, when you are riding your bike down the hill again you occasionally have to worry that a dog will give chase. I also occasionally feel pangs of envy for the people who actually own homes up there, and then I feel guilty about the envy.

Oh, there is also a super cool rope swing hanging off one of the trees on the (east?) side of the mountain. My son catches 'big air' on that swing, it's totally amazing.
author: ellen c.

description:
We love to take our hound dogs to Bernal Hill. It has the most breathtaking view 360 view of SF ever. 
Bernal Hill really is for two things: 
Dog Walking
Hiking or Jogging
If you go there to have a picnic you will most likely be disappointed. There arent any places to plop down, plus most of the flat parts are very rocky.
It's super dog friendly but remember to bring your own bags, don't ruin it for the rest of us.
author: Catty C.

description: Awesome trek up a red rock hill. The views of the city are breathtaking. Interesting vibe with plenty of yuppie couples jogging and doing sit-ups around the top of the hill, with their requisite doodle doggies wagging and sniffing nearby. Not so much a running/frolicking/grassy kind of dog place (so probably would not be our regular dog park), but good for a relatively short, steep, ambling hiking outing together. This is loose red rock on an exposed trail, so it is for somewhat fit people with good knees and shoes with a grip would be helpful. I would not try this on a wet day; it could be muddy and slippery. On the day we went, it was a tad warm and sunny at the top of the hill but there is a cooler area at the base where there is a water fountain with bowls and happy dog socializing. The natural barrier of the hill/trails keeps the dogs safely away from the streets which makes this a 4++ park. Not to mention the exceedingly cutesy Cortland Avenue a few blocks away which has to be the single most dog-friendly village in the U.S.A. There are more dogs than people and the shops (gym, cafes, boutiques) advertise the services they offer for the DOGS. There are poop bag dispensers at the street corners. The dogs actually do outnumber the people. It is like the community exists to entertain and pamper the dogs. Doggy knew it was all for her and was delighted and did not want to leave.
author: p v.

description: I've been here one other time before this weekend and it's still a spectacular 360 view of San Francisco and its surrounding areas overlooking the inner bay and the different highways that criss cross. It's a dog park haven although a lil barren and lacking greens and trees but the view can rival the likes of Twin Peaks and without the tourists!
author: Yan M.

description: We take our dog up for a morning walk every morning. We usually do an evening walk later. If you are a dog owner, this is the great place to run your dog. Our dog live on this hill.  If you like hiking, this is a great place too. Up and down the hill will give you about 2 mile trip. It also gives you nice view of the city. You will be able to see bay bridge, city hall and major streets wind their way into downtown.  So, if you are in the neighborhood, feel free to drop by...
author: Yina M.

description:
I love Bernal Hill, my boy Henry loves Bernal Hill...a tired dog is a happy dog and a happy owner! I love this wind blown bit of The City...though Henry is not so much into the wind...but we hike all over the hill and he has a blast playing with the other dogs. And you know it's not just about the dogs socializing...it's about the people socializing too. I've met some really great people on The Hill from all over the neighboring areas! Some dog lovers, some not. 
My only complaint about Bernal is that if you're going to feast on chicken in the park...don't throw your bones on the ground...chicken bones in little dogs while very tasty is a BAD combination. I'd kinda like to kick the chicken butts of the chicken eating, bone droppers and send them the chicken bones in the dog belly bill....alas they remain anonymous. 
Other than the above, Bernal is a great place for dogs!
author: Simms B.

description:
You can walk along the paved section passing tons of dogs, their owners, and the occasional jogger for good doggie playtime and a little exercise. Or, you can walk up to the non-paved area, hike around, see the gorgeous view of the city, and let your dog really frolic. Personally, Charlie (the dog) and I do both: We park at the bottom and walk up the paved section for Charlie to get his doggie fix. At the top, Charlie will be ready for a slurp of water in the doggie level fountain and then onto the hill. We'll walk all over until we both are panting. And then we'll walk down to the bottom via the path for one last chance for doggie time.  

The dogs are mostly well behaved and the owners are also well behaved in that they pick up after their dogs and try to get their dogs to stop humping Charlie (but quite frankly, I think Charlie is quite capable of getting the dog to stop if he really didn't like it!). 

In the summer it gets VERY dry and not very pretty...but the rest of the year it's usually green and lovely.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I would give this hill/park a five star mark if the sole purpose of me even journeying there wasn't such a huge disappointment.

I set out to find the Legendary Esmerelda St. Slide and after trekking from Cortland over the hill and through the park I was let down by the most un-sliding, traction ridden metal slide I have ever encountered. Even slightly moist this slide couldn't even hope of giving a 5year old enough momentum.

The hill itself is quite majestic, although I was a bit perplexed by the folks hiking with lattes. Who does that? Are they just like "oh yea, I'm parched, let me sip on this scalding dehydrating milky bevvie, that will quench my thist in a jiffy." I just dont get that.

p.s. this park is poo ridden.
author: bo h.

description: I love this park. Amazing views, spacious, big hills to help wear out the pups, and a dog-friendly bar nearby. There aren't really any flat grassy spots, and the rocky surfaces can irritate some dog's paws, but other than that this spot is awesome. Great place to bring the dog on a sunny day for a perfect picnic.
author: Kristen L.

description: A GREAT place to walk your dog as well as get a brilliant 360 view. If you can't go to Fort Funston this is the place.
author: Juliann B.

description: I went late August 2009. I walked all the way up to the top of the hill from the 24th street mission BART stop, up Folsom st. Was beautiful to get to the top where there is a slight breeze.  Awesome view of the city, South San Fran and so much more. Also a great chance to see both the Golden Gate and the Bay Bridge at one vista point. Great workout too!  I hope to go back to catch a sunset and to bring my dog here, there were tons of dogs everywhere, even in the middle of a Friday early afternoon!
author: Eva B.

description:
Compared to Fort Funston, this place is just an okay off leash dog park.  There is a paved road going up to the top and a water fountain for dogs and humans.  Does not provide poop bags, also garbage cans are at the bottom of the hill by the small parking area, or at the top near the water fountain.
The views are really nice on a clear day, be careful if your Fido is obsessed with ball chasing, because some of the edges at the top are pretty steep with no guard rails and if the ball goes over the edge, it's going all the way down.
There is a weird fenced off radar tower at the top.  When the sunsets nice view, but some teenagers smoking pot.  Pretty safe otherwise, no vagrants or trash around.  There are a lot of poop from people forgetting bags, so please don't forget to bring your own!
Summertime can get dusty, small patches of grassy areas for pooches to play hide and seek, but they'll get a bit dusty.
There is no human potties close by, and no tall trees to hide behind to take a leak, there is a portapotty somewhere, but don't remember the exact location.
author: David K.

description: Brought a friend's dog to this park today, real nice hiking spot and AWSOME views! This is why San Francisco is a great city, having so many amazing parks!
author: Karen T.

description: Another favorite SF urban hike.  Depending on your energy level you can walk up from Mission St. or drive higher up to the base of the tree-topped peak but either way you're in for sweeping 360-degree views of The City.  i have taken a few different friends here when they're looking for a plce to live- it's like Google Maps live!  If I've walked all the way up from Mission, I'll stop by the backyard at down-home dyke bar Wild Side West on the way down.  A true SF gem.
author: Eric S.

description: As epic as an epic view can be. Twilight into night. The dogs go home. And the whole thing feels perfect.
author: Josh K.

description:
it's a great hike and workout on the buns leading to the top of this hill.  bring your furry canine friends, and let them off the leash so they can roam around and explore.

deadly views of san francisco on a clear day.
author: Sheri N.

description:
ooh heaven is a place on earth.......i hate this song!

...but for some odd reason, my dog (hi elvis!) loves it. what the fug!

media naranja and i discovered this unfortunate fact (and yes, it's a fact!) when we were first driving to bernal heights park. "heaven is a place on earth" came on the radio.......and elvis suddenly became really excited. he was spinning, dancing and barking to the song. then the song ended, and he was quiet again...

weird...

anyway, we got to the bernal heights park, and he had the best time there.......running around freely. meeting other dogs. chasing birds. pooing and peeing in nature. making unadulterated pure love to other dogs.......boys and girls. he doesn't discriminate...  *sigh*

three months go by...

we are now regulars at bernal heights park. so here we are, driving to bernal heights park again.......and won't you know?......."heaven is a place on earth" comes on the radio again!.......and elvis gets really excited again! he is spinning, dancing and barking again! omg! omg! elvis likes "heaven is a place on earth". what the fug!

so when we got home that day, as much as i hate that song, i downloaded "heaven is a place on earth" on to my ipod.......and now whenever we drive to bernal heights park, i always play the song.......and that's love!

ooh, baby, do you know what that's worth?
ooh heaven is a place on earth
they say in heaven love comes first
we'll make heaven a place on earth
ooh heaven is a place on earth...

.......and that's what bernal heights park is to elvis.......it's a place where elvis can run around freely, meet other dogs, chase birds, poo and pee in nature, and make unadulterated pure love to other dogs.......boys and girls. he doesn't discriminate...  *sigh*
author: frisco j.

description:
i once found the emptiness i was looking for here at night under a black sky. although i am without proper words to truly express my experience, as words tend to confuse as much as they communicate, what i can tell you is that i was able to glimpse pieces of the ultimate reality, transcend my connectedness to the world for a brief moment and put my fears to rest.

5 stars.
author: Karen K.

description: There isn't anywhere to sit (so much for lugging my park chair up the hill), but the views at the top are worth a visit. You can see everything - the Golden Gate Bridge, downtown, Bay Bridge, Twin Peaks, etc. A nice visual reminder of the amazing city in which we live.
author: Jason B.

description: I was hooked the very first time I came here.  Now I bring the dogs I'm petsitting up here almost every day.  They have a great time running up and down the hill, discovering little trails up at the very top, and meeting other dogs.  As for me, I'm swept away by the view.  This is a perfect place for a picnic, because it's not too crowded (say what?!)
author: Chiara H.

description: If you can let your dog off their leash and they will neither run for the border or try and eat small children, then you should be spending your time at Bernal Heights Hill. This is a fantastic park for both pet-owners and non-pet owners alike. The trails/road have different levels of difficulty that all culminate with a gorgeous view of the city. If you do bring your pet, pick up their poo. It is disrespectful to the people without animals and gives dog owners a bad name.
author: Bucky K.

description:
An oasis in the city; located wedged between the Mission and Bernal Heights, this place is paradise found in the middle of the concrete jungle.

Great trails that circle the urban mountain with amazing views of the city. Dog friendly like no other - my has sprinted the hills since he was a puppy.  One of his favorite places too.
author: Peter R.

description: Few things make me as happy as when my pup gets to enjoy some good off leash time midweek. Especially when we get the chance to stray from our usual Upper Noe Valley Recreation Center's dog run. It can't hurt that I also get to claim the hike to the top as a mini-workout (got to make the 3-4 times a week... so I'm countin!) The view is great, and even when the fog is rolling in it is a nice refreshing escape from the confines of the city.
author: Meagan C.

description: Bernal Hill is my favorite park in the City.  I lived in Bernal for several years, and I -so- miss hiking up the hill with my dog.  It's beautiful there any time, but I recommend hitting it early on a foggy, winter morning.  Everything's green and you're all alone (pretty much) and you feel like you're in Ireland (or what you imagine Ireland to be, since you can't afford transcontinental travel because you live in San Francisco for Christ's sake).
author: Sharon M.

description: It's definitely a great place for a walk and seeing those happy critters they call dogs.  Be adventurous and hike up to the towers -- brave that EMF exposure!  Great panoramic views of the city if the weather is clear.
author: Andi T.

description: Marvelous climb with lots of dog watching, people watching, bird watching and incredible views of the city. I've seen a pretty little kestrel flitting about on two occasions. The park feels very undeveloped---as though it had been this way always, since the miners were first panning for gold back in '49. I planted native poppy seeds there with a friend so keep an eye out for some pretty red flowers in a few months. Come to think of it, why not plant a few wildflowers of your own (imagine how wonderful it would be if everyone did it). Just below this park is Precita park with a playground and a vast expanse of lawn to play on, and there are nice neighborhood shops where you could get picnic supplies or coffee.
author: Andrea D.

description: This is a great walk, good on the old ass. It has an amazing view of the city and on a clear day the eastbay. Lots of dogs, but I don't reccomend it ,not good for the pups feet, lots of little pepples and glass, the dog i walk always comes back with little cuts, so I stopped taking her here, but if you go by yourself or with a loved one , it is very beautiful and romantic, you never know what might happen
author: JIll H.

description: Great plot of open space to walk the dog, but those transmission towers make me wonder if my dog is still the only one of the two of us that's been neutered.
author: Hugh B.

description: The park itself is beautiful. I come up here 2x a day and have been for 4 years with my two dogs. It's offleash with plenty of running space for dogs.The views are amazing and always unique. The seasons are noticeable and there's amazing wildlife from snakes, hawks, owls, gophers, to the coyote out in the mornings and evenings. The only reason I'm giving my favorite park 4 stars are the handfuls of annoying, over-protective dog owners up here who treat their dogs like humans and have no idea how normal dogs are supposed to interact with each other.
author: Maggie K.

description: This is a great place to go if you like to catch a whiff of freshly squeezed dog poop in the air and dodge slobber as unleashed canines frollick and dive down the hill in search of transient patties. Forget about bringing a blanket to sit on or a basket of wine and cheese; you'll just look ridiculous as rabid dog walkers blast by -- and there's no grass to sit on, just straw-like weeds and crusty puppy nuggets. But the view is pretty impressive: the beautiful downtown skyline in one direction; what looks to be a concentration camp in the opposite direction.
author: Kevin K.

description: A fantastic park. Tons of cute doggies on their walks and a staggeringly good view of the city, rivaling that of Twin Peaks. It is close to Cortland Ave. with it's cute shops and nice restaurants and cafes.
author: Cyrelle D.

description: The hill is a little barren on top (especially in the dead of summer), but it affords amazing views to the north -- all the way to the downtown skyline -- and to the south, along the 101/280 corridor. If you come here, bring shoes with good traction -- there's a lot of loose gravel on the trails, but if you're careful you won't slip.
author: Beth W.

description: Great for dog watching, like people watching, but for potential dog owners to check out all the hot bitches. Not a lot of basset hounds though. I really love the  floppy ears and stubby little legs.
author: kathy c.

description:
I feel like if I were single, in my mid-30s, and had a dog, I'd walk up here with my dog and use it as a vehicle to flirt with the other single-ish dog walkers.

It's too bad that I only like dogs enough to pet them on the head and return them to their owners once said dog drools or poops in my general vicinity. I much prefer cats. But it's kind of hard to walk a cat on a leash.

So, sometimes, I jog, pant, then promptly walk dogless up here in the evening. Taking in a 360-degree view of the city really does clear my  head after a day at work.

Stalkers, don't be waiting for me atop this hill. Thanks.
author: Mia L.

description:
i love walking up to bernal hill / bernal heights park from my little nook of the mission.  sure, folsom street turns into a semi-brutal hill toward the top, but the views from bernal heights park make the whole thing worth it.

it's so beautiful up here... it's, like, REAL LIVE NATURE in the middle of our fine city. grass, rocks, and soaring hilltops provide incredible views of the entire city. you can even see the golden gate!

lots of cute dogs, too. i saw a woman up here yesterday getting crazy with the hand weights and yoga mat.  ahhh, san francisco!
author: Elle B.

description: Taking a walk to the top of this place in the morning and seeing a 360 degree view of SF is amazing.  Great exercise with an amazing reward a the end.  I will have to take some pictures tomorrow morning and upload them to this profile!
author: Pele N.

description: I love the Hill. It's one of the last places in the city where you can take your dog off leash legally, and I've never had a problem with aggressive dogs or weird people (like Dolores Park). The views from the top are amazing, with 360 degree views of the city. You can see the Golden Gate Bridge AND Candlestick standing on the same spot. It's also a good place to go to see fireworks or the Blue Angels.
author: G G.

description: After living in SF for 23 years, I finally went up to the top of this thing.  I actuallynever really noticed this spot until last year.  Looks to be great for dog owners.  Panoramic views of the city.  Its real quiet at night, great for getting away from it all.  If I had a dog, I would be up there everyday.  Twin Peaks is overrated.
author: andrew l.

description: Nice place to get away from it all and enjoy the lovely view of the city from the top.
author: Zell C.

description: Gorgeous panoramic views of the city!   Another benefit is that you have a choice of either walking the paved area, or you can walk up the slope and climb the trails or rocks.  Best, there is a three ring circus of dog activity here for community entertainment.  All and all, this park is tops for dogs and people, whether accompanied by furry chaperones, or not.
author: Gwen E.

description: I love the view from this hill. You can really see the whole city and even spot out the bay bridge and golden gate bridge. This is a nice place to bring your dog too because there are many open fields. The walk can be hard if you climb up the hills.. but its a nice workout and you feel better from all that clean air!
author: christy w.

description: Best view of the city, lots of dogs, great place to sit and read, or think, don't go expecting much more then dogs and an amazing view. Brought my family from Montana up Bernal Hill, even the fam from Montana thought the view was amazing.
author: Teresa J.

description: Great place for a morning walk and amazing view of the city! Lots of locals with kids and dogs will pass through as you sit on the lone bench up top. Grab a coffee from Martha Bros on Cortland first and enjoy!
author: Katherine N.

description: I always ride my bike up to the top.  It's a great view and not too tough a climb.  Great for dogs.  Most people bring their dogs there.
author: Mitch A.

description:
what's better at 6:30 in the morning than watching your pooch roam free to scour all the leftover poop she can gobble in a half-hour period? i love the hill. bring your coffee and watch the sunrise over the bay or take your furry signifigant other for a mini hike on the trails. 

either way you've gotten outside and given your dog a good little outing which makes for less couch eating and/or kitty box raids.
author: Jess T.

description: Five stars, because who gives a hill a bad review?  I mean, how lucky are we that we live in this great city and there are hills everywhere, and they let you and your neighbors' dogs climb all over them! We are blessed I tell you.
author: J. R.

description: Great to climb with friends and random people at three in the morning (with heels on) when you've had a few drinks...
author: Hannah F.

description: This is a great spot to take your pooch out.  Captain loved running on the steep grassy hills and checking out the amazing views of the city.  The park has some flat rocky areas where the dogs can run around and a doggie water fountain when it is time to cool off.  After a day at the park check out some of the great doggie friendly places on Cortland Ave the ever tasty including Progressive Grounds.
author: Garrett D.

description: What a journey, what a view! Lovely on a sunny day! I go here when life gets too hectic.  Breath the fresh air and take it all in!
author: Mel P.

description: anybody that is smart, will go here on fourth of july. Fuck Chrissy Field, Fuck the ballpark...this is the jam. You can see for miles. You could totally make out here(i have actually in my former life ) . Its a hike up for sure, and be careful on the way down. I slipped once and my friend Al pulled some ninja move and saved my life .
author: Lauren V.

description: I love this park.  Great views, kinda desolate (on the edge of the inner mission), great dog partk.  Check it out, dog or not!
author: sam p.

description: I love my home neighborhood. It has the right balance of enough attractions/things to do yet tranquility.
author: Nick S.

description: It's the crazy 360 degree city views, silly! Worth the hike! Bring a camera...
author: Maximillian M.

description: I went here once with my dog to meet up with a friend. I live clear out on the other side of town, so I doubt I'd go out of my way to take my dog out for a hike/walk here. It was ok, I think there's a lot more places that are nicer than here. I can see if you live in this area, to take your dog, but I didn't see anything special about the hill, but a different view of the city.
author: M M.

description: The views from the hill remind me of why I heart SF, and of why, regardless of the hassles and high cost of living in the City, I always keep coming back for more.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
+
Awesome views, cool raptors, I like the grass when it dies in the summer.

-
Dogs. Dog shit. Dog owners.
author: Geoff R.

description: I just love it here. Unbelievable 360 views of the entire bay area, bridge to bridge etc.  Bring your dog as this is doggie heaven. Then walk down to Bernal Heights and grab a bite to eat at many of their boutique eateries.  When you visit here, you are reminded of why you live in SF.   Be on the lookout for the local pair of owls.
author: Rick S.

description: I have walked around and around this hill and it's a pretty good hill! The rocks are crumbly.  Go to the north side and look down upon the  Mission St. Safeway. You are privileged and entitled from this vantage point. Farewell, Bernal Heights Hill.
author: Brad J.

description: i never really knew about this place until my boyfriend brought me up here. we came here at night and i remembered he was parked mid way and we would just talk about random things. then he also took me up there and we looked down from up top, we saw a lot of things. it's really nice during the night time and so it's the day time too. i find it romantic to take your date up here. i also came up here during new year with my boyfriend, altho watching fireworks from up there, sucks because you can't really see anything, but it's okay at least we avoid the crowd.
author: Valerie N.

description: I love this place! This is one place i'll let my dog roam off-leash so her friends can sniff her ass and vice versa. The view is spectacular...wouldn't mind snuggling with a partner just watching nature throughout the course of the day. You get a 360-pano view of the whole SF (golden gate bridge, civic center, financial district, mission bay, soma, the highway maze, and more. The path around Bernal Hill is quite easy, there's even a map on the top of the hill which mentions the grade incline/decline which is not more than 6%. The walk up the hill will warrant beautiful views...
author: May S.

description: great view of the city without the tourists.   also a good idea to mix in some exercise and a popular place to walk the dog.
author: Richie W.

description: Bernal Heights Hill is an example of what makes San Francisco great. It's one of the city's many urban green spaces. It's a great place for you and your pooch to walk and offers 360 degree views. There's quite a few staircases leading to the park that are nestled in between homes--there's  a slide adjacent to one staircase for youngsters to enjoy.
author: Marina D.

description: One thing that is important to note about Bernal Heights Hill is that you can get there from many directions.  To walk up from the Inner Mission side (say Florida Street) you can walk up cute little staircases to get up there with many flowers and the smell of jasmine.  So don't think that it is necessarily better to drive.
author: Matthew N.

description: bernal hill is a great hill to sit atop of and breathe as well as take a few landscape shots. sitting on the slope of the hill looking north, the views are breathtaking... seeing all the way to the haight, marina, the bridge, downtown, and so much more. loads of doggies roaming around too.
author: Court L.
